message.content:
i want to add to the install.sh file the command: ln -s /Users/user/dev/dotfiles/.claude /Users/user/.claude
which will make the .claude folder sync with the base folder

content.text: I'll help you add that symbolic link command to your install.sh file, yonatanlou. Let me first read the current install.sh file to see its structure.

file.content:
#!/bin/zsh

# Functions for each installation step
install_homebrew() {
  echo "üç∫ Setting up Homebrew..."
  if test ! $(which brew); then
    echo "Installing Homebrew..."
    ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"
  fi
  
  echo "Updating Homebrew recipes..."
  brew update
  
  echo "Installing Homebrew packages..."
  brew bundle --file=./Brewfile
}

apply_macos_preferences() {
  echo "üçé Applying macOS preferences..."
  ./macos.sh
}

link_bin_scripts() {
  echo "üîó Linking scripts from ./bin to ~/bin..."
  mkdir -p ~/bin
  
  # Make scripts executable first
  chmod +x ./bin/*
  
  for file in ./bin/*; do
    ln -sf "$PWD/$file" ~/bin/
  done
}

show_help() {
  echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
  echo ""
  echo "Options:"
  echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
  echo "  -b, --brew     Install Homebrew and packages only"
  echo "  -m, --macos    Apply macOS preferences only"
  echo "  -s, --scripts  Link bin scripts only"
  echo "  -a, --all      Run all steps (default)"
  echo ""
  echo "Examples:"
  echo "  $0              # Run all steps"
  echo "  $0 --scripts    # Only link bin scripts"
  echo "  $0 -b -s        # Install brew packages and link scripts"
}

# Parse command line arguments
RUN_BREW=false
RUN_MACOS=false
RUN_SCRIPTS=false
RUN_ALL=true

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  case $1 in
    -h|--help)
      show_help
      exit 0
      ;;
    -b|--brew)
      RUN_BREW=true
      RUN_ALL=false
      shift
      ;;
    -m|--macos)
      RUN_MACOS=true
      RUN_ALL=false
      shift
      ;;
    -s|--scripts)
      RUN_SCRIPTS=true
      RUN_ALL=false
      shift
      ;;
    -a|--all)
      RUN_ALL=true
      shift
      ;;
    *)
      echo "Unknown option: $1"
      show_help
      exit 1
      ;;
  esac
done

# Run selected steps
if [[ "$RUN_ALL" == true ]]; then
  install_homebrew
  apply_macos_preferences
  link_bin_scripts
else
  if [[ "$RUN_BREW" == true ]]; then
    install_homebrew
  fi
  
  if [[ "$RUN_MACOS" == true ]]; then
    apply_macos_preferences
  fi
  
  if [[ "$RUN_SCRIPTS" == true ]]; then
    link_bin_scripts
  fi
fi

echo "‚úÖ Setup complete!"

  for file in ./bin/*; do
    ln -sf "$PWD/$file" ~/bin/
  done
}

# Functions for each installation step
install_homebrew() {
  echo "üç∫ Setting up Homebrew..."
  if test ! $(which brew); then
    echo "Installing Homebrew..."

  fi

  brew bundle --file=./Brewfile
}

apply_macos_preferences() {
  echo "üçé Applying macOS preferences..."
  ./macos.sh
}

link_bin_scripts() {
  echo "üîó Linking scripts from ./bin to ~/bin..."
  mkdir -p ~/bin
  
  # Make scripts executable first
  chmod +x ./bin/*
  
  for file in ./bin/*; do
    ln -sf "$PWD/$file" ~/bin/
  done
}

show_help() {
  echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
  echo ""

  echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
  echo "  -b, --brew     Install Homebrew and packages only"
  echo "  -m, --macos    Apply macOS preferences only"
  echo "  -s, --scripts  Link bin scripts only"

  echo "  $0 --scripts    # Only link bin scripts"
  echo "  $0 -b -s        # Install brew packages and link scripts"

# Parse command line arguments

RUN_MACOS=false
RUN_SCRIPTS=false
RUN_ALL=true

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do

    -h|--help)

    -b|--brew)

      shift

    -m|--macos)

      RUN_ALL=false

    -s|--scripts)

done

  if [[ "$RUN_MACOS" == true ]]; then
    apply_macos_preferences

  if [[ "$RUN_SCRIPTS" == true ]]; then

fi

echo "‚úÖ Setup complete!"

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/zsh

# Functions for each installation step
install_homebrew() {
  echo "üç∫ Setting up Homebrew..."
  if test ! $(which brew); then
    echo "Installing Homebrew..."
    ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"
  fi
  
  echo "Updating Homebrew recipes..."
  brew update
  
  echo "Installing Homebrew packages..."
  brew bundle --file=./Brewfile
}

apply_macos_preferences() {
  echo "üçé Applying macOS preferences..."
  ./macos.sh
}

link_bin_scripts() {
  echo "üîó Linking scripts from ./bin to ~/bin..."
  mkdir -p ~/bin
  
  # Make scripts executable first
  chmod +x ./bin/*
  
  for file in ./bin/*; do
    ln -sf "$PWD/$file" ~/bin/
  done
}

link_claude_config() {
  echo "ü§ñ Linking Claude configuration..."
  ln -sf /Users/user/dev/dotfiles/.claude /Users/user/.claude
}

show_help() {
  echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
  echo ""
  echo "Options:"
  echo "  -h, --help     Show this help message"
  echo "  -b, --brew     Install Homebrew and packages only"
  echo "  -m, --macos    Apply macOS preferences only"
  echo "  -s, --scripts  Link bin scripts only"
  echo "  -c, --claude   Link Claude configuration only"
  echo "  -a, --all      Run all steps (default)"
  echo ""
  echo "Examples:"
  echo "  $0              # Run all steps"
  echo "  $0 --scripts    # Only link bin scripts"
  echo "  $0 -b -s        # Install brew packages and link scripts"
  echo "  $0 --claude     # Only link Claude configuration"
}

# Parse command line arguments
RUN_BREW=false
RUN_MACOS=false
RUN_SCRIPTS=false
RUN_CLAUDE=false
RUN_ALL=true

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  case $1 in
    -h|--help)
      show_help
      exit 0
      ;;
    -b|--brew)
      RUN_BREW=true
      RUN_ALL=false
      shift
      ;;
    -m|--macos)
      RUN_MACOS=true
      RUN_ALL=false
      shift
      ;;
    -s|--scripts)
      RUN_SCRIPTS=true
      RUN_ALL=false
      shift
      ;;
    -a|--all)
      RUN_ALL=true
      shift
      ;;
    *)
      echo "Unknown option: $1"
      show_help
      exit 1
      ;;
  esac
done

# Run selected steps
if [[ "$RUN_ALL" == true ]]; then
  install_homebrew
  apply_macos_preferences
  link_bin_scripts
else
  if [[ "$RUN_BREW" == true ]]; then
    install_homebrew
  fi
  
  if [[ "$RUN_MACOS" == true ]]; then
    apply_macos_preferences
  fi
  
  if [[ "$RUN_SCRIPTS" == true ]]; then
    link_bin_scripts
  fi
fi

echo "‚úÖ Setup complete!"

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully added the Claude configuration linking to your install.sh script. The changes include:

1. **New function**: `link_claude_config()` that creates the symbolic link
2. **Updated help**: Added `-c, --claude` option to the help text
3. **New variable**: `RUN_CLAUDE=false` for tracking the option
4. **Argument parsing**: Added case for `-c|--claude` 
5. **Execution logic**: Added the function call to both the "run all" path and individual step execution

Now you can:
- Run `./install.sh` to execute all steps including Claude config linking
- Run `./install.sh --claude` to only link the Claude configuration
- Use it in combination with other flags like `./install.sh -s -c`

The symbolic link will sync your `.claude` folder from the dotfiles repo to your home directory, keeping your Claude configuration in version control.
You're right, yonatanlou! The hardcoded paths won't work on other Macs. Let me fix that to make it work from any location and for any user.

content.text:
Perfect! Now the function uses:
- `$PWD/.claude` - the current working directory (where the script is run from)
- `$HOME/.claude` - the user's home directory

This will work on any Mac regardless of username or where the dotfiles are located, as long as the script is run from the dotfiles directory.
